intro: Betonica nemorosa, commonly known as spring betony, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features opposite, hairy, ovate leaves and produces clusters of blue or violet flowers in early spring. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Betonica nemorosa is often used in herbal medicine for its purported soothing properties.
